decks.notes: This Bant Control deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by countering key spells, removing threats, and controlling the board. The deck uses cards like Force of Will, Spell Pierce, and Pyroblast to counter spells, while also using Swords to Plowshares and Supreme Verdict to remove threats on the board. Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Time Raveler provide card advantage and control options, while cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Monastery Mentor provide additional threats and value. The deck also utilizes cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder, along with mana fixing cards like Arcum's Astrolabe to ensure smooth gameplay.

The main concept of this deck is to play a variety of powerful control cards to manipulate the board and counter opponent's spells, while generating card advantage with card draw and efficient threats. The deck aims to stall the game with removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Supreme Verdict, while leveraging powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to control the game. Additionally, the deck includes efficient creatures like Ice-Fang Coatl and Oko, Thief of Crowns to pressure opponents and generate advantage. The deck also plays versatile cards like Force of Will and Council's Judgment to handle a variety of threats.

The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating incremental advantage through card draw and value creatures. It utilizes a combination of disruptive spells like Force of Will and Abrupt Decay, along with versatile threats like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Bitterblossom. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the multicolor requirements of the deck, with mana dorks like Noble Hierarch and Gilded Goose helping to ramp into the more expensive spells. Overall, the deck seeks to control the game early on before transitioning into a proactive midrange strategy to close out the game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures using cards like Careful Study and Stitcher's Supplier, then use Altar of Dementia to sacrifice those creatures and bring back Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis and Vengevine for a powerful combo finish. The deck also utilizes cards like Bridge from Below and Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's strategy and keep the pressure on. Overall, the key concept is to efficiently use graveyard synergies and combo pieces to overwhelm the opponent and secure a fast victory.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure through aggressive creatures and equipment. By utilizing cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Sanctum Prelate to slow down the opponent, as well as Mother of Runes and equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Batterskull for protection and additional power, the deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent. The deck also utilizes cards like Flickerwisp and Recruiter of the Guard for versatility and card advantage, making it a versatile and powerful aggressive deck.

This UWx Control deck focuses on using counterspells and removal to control the board while utilizing card draw and manipulation to maintain card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy, protect its own threats, and eventually win the game through a combination of powerful planeswalkers, efficient removal spells, and efficient card advantage engines. It also utilizes snow lands and Astrolabe to enable consistency and flexibility in mana base while utilizing Mystic Sanctuary to recycle powerful spells from the graveyard.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures using cards like Hedron Crab, Stitcher's Supplier, and Careful Study, in order to recur valuable creatures like Bloodghast and Gravecrawler. By using cards like Altar of Dementia and Bridge from Below, the deck can create an overwhelming token army with Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis and Vengevine. Additionally, Cabal Therapy can disrupt the opponent's game plan by stripping key cards from their hand. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of graveyard recursion and powerful creatures.

The focus of this deck is to efficiently assemble the Dark Depths combo using cards like Vampire Hexmage and Thespian's Stage. The deck features disruption in the form of Duress and Thoughtseize to protect the combo and control the opponent's resources. Additionally, cards like Sylvan Safekeeper and Mox Diamond provide additional support and acceleration. The deck leverages the synergy between different cards to execute a game-winning combo quickly and consistently, making it a powerful and strategic choice for Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

This deck focuses on establishing a fast and aggressive board presence using efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dreadhorde Arcanist while disrupting the opponent's strategy with counterspells like Daze and Force of Will. The deck also includes plenty of burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Chain Lightning to finish off opponents quickly. With cantrips such as Brainstorm and Ponder, the deck aims to maintain card advantage and find its key threats. The mana base is optimized for speed and consistency, with Wasteland providing disruption against opposing non-basic lands.

The primary focus of this deck is to establish control over the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy while generating card advantage and value through efficient spells and creatures. The deck aims to use a combination of removal, counterspells, and card draw to control the board and outvalue the opponent. Key cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Bitterblossom provide strong threats and incremental advantage, while cards like Force of Will and Abrupt Decay help to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base is designed to provide stability and consistency to support the control game plan.

The deck is focused on utilizing a combination of efficient creatures, disruptive spells, and mana acceleration to apply pressure on the opponent while controlling the board. It seeks to generate card advantage through cards like Sylvan Library and Leovold, Emissary of Trest, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Force of Will and Abrupt Decay. The deck's main goal is to establish an early board presence and maintain control of the game through efficient removal and card advantage, ultimately outvaluing the opponent and overwhelming them with threats.

The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to efficiently control and disrupt the opponent while applying pressure with efficient threats like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, True-Name Nemesis, Gurmag Angler, and Dreadhorde Arcanist. The deck utilizes disruptive cards like Thoughtseize, Force of Will, Daze, and Fatal Push to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also having efficient card draw and manipulation with Preordain, Ponder, and Brainstorm. This deck aims to win the game quickly by overwhelming the opponent with threats and disruption.

The deck focuses on generating card advantage and controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and powerful planeswalkers like Teferi and Jace. It utilizes a variety of card draw and manipulation spells to ensure consistency and stay ahead in the game. In addition, it incorporates snow lands and creatures to enable synergy with cards like Ice-Fang Coatl and Arcum's Astrolabe. The goal is to outvalue the opponent, disrupt their game plan, and ultimately secure victory through superior card advantage and board control.

The main concept of this UWx Control deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. The deck aims to disrupt opponents' strategies with cards like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares, while also generating card advantage with cards like Brainstorm and Accumulated Knowledge. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Jace, the Mind Sculptor provides additional utility and win conditions. Mystic Sanctuary allows the deck to recur important spells like Terminus, ensuring the deck maintains control throughout the game.

The main concept of the deck is to control the game by utilizing powerful counter spells and removal cards, while also having card advantage through cards like Brainstorm and Snapcaster Mage. The deck aims to control the board through various board wipes like Terminus and Supreme Verdict, while also having the ability to win the game with cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Entreat the Angels. The mana base is built to support the diverse color requirements of the spells in the deck.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently fill the graveyard with creatures and then utilize the combination of Bridge from Below, Altar of Dementia, and Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis to create a powerful and unstoppable swarm of creatures. The deck also includes cards like Vengevine, Stitcher's Supplier, and Hedron Crab to facilitate the graveyard filling process and enable additional combos and synergy. The aim of the deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a large number of creatures and use their abilities to create advantageous scenarios and win the game.
